snippet: Prosecutors used the same narrative that failed to convict in three previous cases in arguing that Lt. Brian Rice had committed a crime during Mr. Gray’s arrest....
abstract: Prosecutors in case of Baltimore Police Lt Brian Rice, who is charged with negligent conduct leading to death of Freddie Gray in 2015, use largely same arguments that failed to convict police officers Edward M Nero, Caesar R Goodson Jr and William G Porter in previous three trials; remains to be seen whether main difference in case, Rice's proximity to Gray in police van, will bring different verdict.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors used the same narrative that failed to convict in three previous cases in arguing that Lt. Brian Rice had committed a crime during Mr. Gray’s arrest.

headline.main: Closing Arguments Sound Familiar at 4th Trial in Freddie Gray Case
headline.print_headline: Closing Arguments Sound Familiar at Fourth Trial in Freddie Gray Case
